Review: I got these as a back-up pair during Prime Days for $45. I use earbuds a lot and have several pairs from different manufacturers. They'll connect to multiple devices and switch automatically which is nice; but have an odd quick in that while you're listening with them they'll disconnect from one of the devices by themselves for no reason and without any movement of the buds and the connected devices (e.g. me sitting on my bed with connected iPhone and iPad both on my nightstand 2 ft away). When they disconnect; one of the ear buds loses connectivity which is annoying and requires manually reconnecting to the device you're listening to or even having to turn Bluetooth off and then back on and then reconnecting. Summary: Sound and battery life are decent; Alexa is an annoyance for me since I'm not an Alexa user; and they're clunky in terms of size and fit. These buds go in my bag as a third or fourth string pair when my others are out of juice. In terms of value for the money; at $45 they were a good deal but if I'd paid $145 I probably would've returned them. There are lots of good ear bud choices out there these days and too many better alternatives at that $145-$150 price point. I gave them a 3-Star rating only because they were decent value for what I paid. I would've given 2 stars if I'd paid full price. Sorry Amazon.
